text: Sir Richard Andrew Snowden (born 22 March 1962), styled The Hon. Mr Justice Snowden, is a judge of the High Court of England and Wales. Snowden was educated at Downing College, Cambridge, and Harvard Law School. He was called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn in 1986, and elected a Bencher in 2010. He was appointed a Queen's Counsel in 2003, a Recorder in 2006, and a Deputy High Court Judge in 2008. He was a member of the Insolvency Rules Committee between 2002 and 2012. He also edited several works on company and insolvency law. Snowden was appointed a Justice of the High Court (Chancery Division) on 30 April 2015, following the elevation of Mr Justice Sales to the Court of Appeal, and received the customary knighthood the same year. On September 19 2019, Snowden took on the role of Vice-Chancellor of the County Palatine and became Supervising Judge of the Business and Property Courts for the North and North-Eastern Circuits following Mr Justice Barling’s retirement. == References == Category:1962 births Category:Chancery Division judges Category:English Queen's Counsel Category:Queen's Counsel 2001– Category:Alumni of Downing College, Cambridge Category:Harvard Law School alumni Category:Knights Bachelor Category:Living people
